TopicTitle: So I built a thing. Moar rockets!

Articles.Content:
Craft file to follow when I work out the last few kinks.

It has 13.5km/s dv without a payload and has the ability to send two of the largest Kerbodyne tanks directly to Jool fully fueled and without any added input. Or you could use it to lift the entire ISS to orbit in a single launch.

I think you are expending too much resources to do a thing. This Way Kerbin will decrease in size after every launch. lol

And i don't tell about the aerodynamics, besides the fact it won't affect vanilla KSP, have no aesthetics.

But the cargo you are putting on jool on one part, is amazing.

My machine couldn't handle this number of parts.

To that cargo you say put on Jool, is like an SSTO? Or SSTJ? (Single Stage To Jool)

I think you are expending too much resources to do a thing. This Way Kerbin will decrease in size after every launch. lol

And i don't tell about the aerodynamics, besides the fact it won't affect vanilla KSP, have no aesthetics.

But the cargo you are putting on jool on one part, is amazing.

My machine couldn't handle this number of parts.

To that cargo you say put on Jool, is like an SSTO? Or SSTJ? (Single Stage To Jool)

I didn't bother with aerodynamics, I don't use FAR, I just wanted to get it done.

The partcount is only like 1340, so it's not excruciating, you could remove struts and lower it further. But be prepared for SUDs (sudden unintentional dis-assembly).

It isn't an SSTO, with one Kerbodyne tank, it requires the first two rings of asparagus staging to a 650km circular orbit, with two it requires the first three rings.

The fifth stage alone is enough to transfer to and circularize around Jool.

Edited June 5, 2014 by Himynameisjake
